name: Kepler-309
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-309 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-309 is a star with 0.615 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.72 times its radius. It is located 1804.29 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-309 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-309 b

Kepler-309 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.06 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 5.92 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-309.

The mass of Kepler-309 b is 2.79 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-309 b is 1.56 that of Earth. At 2.79 Earth masses, Kepler-309 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-309 c

Kepler-309 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.40 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 105.36 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-309.

The mass of Kepler-309 c is 8.77 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-309 c is 2.51 that of Earth. At 8.77 Earth masses, Kepler-309 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

With a semi-major axis of 0.401 astronomical units, and a mass of 8.77 Earth masses, Kepler-309 c could, potentially, be a habitable planet with stable bodies of liquid water on its surface, like Earth.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-309, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
